014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper;
015
016import java.sql.ResultSet;
017import java.sql.SQLException;
018
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
021
022/**
023 * Maps result set rows to objects.
024 *
025 * @param <T> the mapped type.
026 * @see RowMappers
027 * @see RowMapperFactory
028 * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultBearing#map(RowMapper)
029 * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.config.Configurable#registerRowMapper(RowMapper)
030 * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.config.Configurable#registerRowMapper(java.lang.reflect.Type, RowMapper)
031 */
032@FunctionalInterface
033public interface RowMapper<T> {
034    /**
035     * Map the current row of the result set.
036     * This method should not cause the result set to advance; allow Jdbi to do that, please.
037     *
038     * @param rs  the result set being iterated
039     * @param ctx the statement context
040     * @return the value to produce for this row
041     * @throws SQLException if anything goes wrong go ahead and let this percolate; Jdbi will handle it
042     */
043    T map(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException;
044
045    /**
046     * Returns a specialized row mapper, optimized for the given result set.
047     * <p>
048     * Before mapping the result set from a SQL statement; Jdbi will first call this method to obtain a specialized
049     * instance. The returned mapper will then be used to map the result set rows, and discarded.
050     * <p>
051     * Implementing this method is optional; the default implementation returns {@code this}. Implementors might choose
052     * to override this method to improve performance, e.g. by matching up column names to properties once for the
053     * entire result set, rather than repeating the process for every row.
054     *
055     * @param rs  the result set to specialize over
056     * @param ctx the statement context to specialize over
057     * @return a row mapper equivalent to this one, possibly specialized.
058     * @throws SQLException if anything goes wrong go ahead and let this percolate; Jdbi will handle it
059     * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect.BeanMapper for an example of specialization.
060     */
061    default RowMapper<T> specialize(ResultSet rs, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
062        return this;
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Allows for initialization of the row mapper instance within a ConfigRegistry scope. This method is called once when the row mapper is first used from a
067     * ConfigRegistry.
068     * <p>
069     * Note that handles, statements, sql objects etc. all create copies of the registry, and this method will be called for every copy
070     *
071     * @param registry A reference to the {@link ConfigRegistry} that this instance belongs to.
072     */
073    default void init(ConfigRegistry registry) {}
074}
